trans-unit.source: Exercise – Process a Rent Order with Rate Components

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Process a Rent Order with Rate Components

trans-unit.source: On January 31, 2019, customer R-20000 requests one unit of item R-20000-01 for the period of 02/01/19 through 02/28/19. This item includes two rate parts (taxes and insurance) and a one-time cleaning fee due at the end of the rental.

seg-source.mrk: On January 31, 2019, customer R-20000 requests one unit of item R-20000-01 for the period of 02/01/19 through 02/28/19.
This item includes two rate parts (taxes and insurance) and a one-time cleaning fee due at the end of the rental.

trans-unit.source: Create and Ship the Rent Order

seg-source.mrk: Create and Ship the Rent Order

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create and ship the rent order:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to create and ship the rent order:

trans-unit.source: Set the Work Date to 01/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: Set the Work Date to 01/31/19.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click cc|rental > Contract Management > Rent Orders.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click cc|rental > Contract Management > Rent Orders.

trans-unit.source: Insert a new rent order for customer R-20000.

seg-source.mrk: Insert a new rent order for customer R-20000.

trans-unit.source:
Expand the Rental FastTab and enter the following:
  1. Rental Rate Code = Month
  2. Rental Start Date = 02/01/19
  3. Rental End Date = 02/28/19
  4. Prepaid = Yes

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Rental FastTab and enter the following:
• Rental Rate Code = Month
• Rental Start Date = 02/01/19
• Rental End Date = 02/28/19
• Prepaid = Yes

trans-unit.source: In the Lines FastTab, select Item in the Type field.

seg-source.mrk: In the Lines FastTab, select Item in the Type field.

trans-unit.source:
In the No. field, enter R-20000-01 and then press ENTER. Notice the following:
  • Three lines are added below the rent item line:
    • Two Rate Part line (INSURANCE and TAX1)
    • One-Time Invoicing line (CLEANRETURN)
  • Rental information on the rent item line (except for the Rate Unit Price) is the same as on the Rate Part lines, but is not carried to the One-Time Invoicing line

seg-source.mrk: In the No.
field, enter R-20000-01 and then press ENTER.
Notice the following:
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">Three lines are added below the rent item line:
• Two Rate Part line (INSURANCE and TAX1)
• One-Time Invoicing line (CLEANRETURN)
• Rental information on the rent item line (except for the Rate Unit Price) is the same as on the Rate Part lines, but is not carried to the One-Time Invoicing line

trans-unit.source: : Rent Order with rate component lines

seg-source.mrk: : Rent Order with rate component lines

trans-unit.source: On the rent item line, enter 1 in the Quantity field. Notice that the same quantity is added to the Rate Component lines.

seg-source.mrk: On the rent item line, enter 1 in the Quantity field.
Notice that the same quantity is added to the Rate Component lines.

trans-unit.source:
In the Rate Unit Price field, enter the following values (if missing):
  • Rent item line  = 1375
  • Insurance line = 50
  • Tax line = 80

seg-source.mrk: In the Rate Unit Price field, enter the following values (if missing):
• Rent item line  = 1375
• Insurance line = 50
• Tax line = 80

trans-unit.source: : Rent Order with rate unit prices added

seg-source.mrk: : Rent Order with rate unit prices added

trans-unit.source:
Select the rent item line and then click Line > Item Tracking Lines on the Lines FastTab.
A dialog opens for item tracking selection.

seg-source.mrk: Select the rent item line and then click Line > Item Tracking Lines on the Lines FastTab.
A dialog opens for item tracking selection.

trans-unit.source: : Shipment selection for item tracking

seg-source.mrk: : Shipment selection for item tracking

trans-unit.source: With the Shipment option selected, click OK.

seg-source.mrk: With the Shipment option selected, click OK.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Select Entries.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Select Entries.

trans-unit.source: : Serial Number selection

seg-source.mrk: : Serial Number selection

trans-unit.source: Note which serial number is selected and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Note which serial number is selected and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Item Tracking Lines page.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the Item Tracking Lines page.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: With the Ship option selected, click OK.

seg-source.mrk: With the Ship option selected, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Invoice the Rent Order

seg-source.mrk: Invoice the Rent Order

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to invoice the rent order:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to invoice the rent order:

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 02/28/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 02/28/19.

trans-unit.source: Click OK and accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK and accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the line to open the Service Invoice Rental page. Notice that the rental item and the two Rate Part components appear with the same values entered on the Rent Order line.

seg-source.mrk: Double-click the line to open the Service Invoice Rental page.
Notice that the rental item and the two Rate Part components appear with the same values entered on the Rent Order line.

trans-unit.source: : Service Invoice for rental and rate part component positions

seg-source.mrk: : Service Invoice for rental and rate part component positions

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: On the Navigate tab, click Entries > Rental Ledger Entries. Notice that the rental and rate part component lines appear.

seg-source.mrk: On the Navigate tab, click Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.
Notice that the rental and rate part component lines appear.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Ledger Entries for a posted invoice with rental and rate part component positions

seg-source.mrk: : Rental Ledger Entries for a posted invoice with rental and rate part component positions

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: Return the Rent Order and Invoice the One-Time Invoicing Component

seg-source.mrk: Return the Rent Order and Invoice the One-Time Invoicing Component

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to return the rent order and invoice the One-Time Invoicing component:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to return the rent order and invoice the One-Time Invoicing component:

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/28/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/28/19.

trans-unit.source: On the rental item line, enter 02/28/19 in the Rental Return Date field.

seg-source.mrk: On the rental item line, enter 02/28/19 in the Rental Return Date field.

trans-unit.source: In the Return Qty. to Receive field, enter 1. Notice that the Rate Part component lines are updated with the return information, but the One-Time Invoicing component line is still unchanged.

seg-source.mrk: In the <span class="Bold">Return Qty.
to Receive field, enter 1.
Notice that the Rate Part component lines are updated with the return information, but the One-Time Invoicing component line is still unchanged.

trans-unit.source: : Rent Order lines ready for return processing

seg-source.mrk: : Rent Order lines ready for return processing

trans-unit.source: Select the rental item line and then click Line > Item Tracking Lines on the Lines FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: Select the rental item line and then click Line > Item Tracking Lines on the Lines FastTab.

trans-unit.source: Select the Receive option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Receive option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: : Receipt selection for item tracking

seg-source.mrk: : Receipt selection for item tracking

trans-unit.source: Confirm that the serial number is correct and then click OK to close the Item Tracking Lines page.

seg-source.mrk: Confirm that the serial number is correct and then click OK to close the Item Tracking Lines page.

trans-unit.source: : Serial number to be returned

seg-source.mrk: : Serial number to be returned

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: Select the Receive option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Receive option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source:
Notice the following:
  • The receipt is processed on the rent item line and the rate part components.
  • The Quantity Shipped field and Qty. to Invoice fields are set to 1 on the One-Time Invoicing component line.

seg-source.mrk: Notice the following:
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">The receipt is processed on the rent item line and the rate part components.
• The Quantity Shipped field and Qty.
to Invoice fields are set to 1 on the One-Time Invoicing component line.

trans-unit.source: : Rent Order after return processing

seg-source.mrk: : Rent Order after return processing

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Reopen.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Reopen.

trans-unit.source: On the One-Time Invoicing component line, type 100 in the Unit Price Excl. VAT field.

seg-source.mrk: On the One-Time Invoicing component line, type 100 in the <span class="Bold">Unit Price Excl.
VAT field.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/28/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/28/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 02/28/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 02/28/19.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

trans-unit.source: Open the invoice and notice that the cleaning charge appears on the line with the amount entered in step 11 as the unit price.

seg-source.mrk: Open the invoice and notice that the cleaning charge appears on the line with the amount entered in step 11 as the unit price.

trans-unit.source: : Sales invoice for the One-Time Invoicing component

seg-source.mrk: : Sales invoice for the One-Time Invoicing component

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the rent order. Notice that the Quantity Invoiced field on the One-Time Invoicing component line is set to 1.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the rent order.
Notice that the Quantity Invoiced field on the One-Time Invoicing component line is set to 1.

trans-unit.source: On the Navigate tab, click Entries > Rental Ledger Entries. Notice that the One-Time Invoicing component line appears.

seg-source.mrk: On the Navigate tab, click Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.
Notice that the One-Time Invoicing component line appears.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Ledger Entries for posted invoices with rental and all component positions

seg-source.mrk: : Rental Ledger Entries for posted invoices with rental and all component positions

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the rent order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the rent order.
